lines.text: Johnny, wait a minute. I want you to carry this with you.
What is it?
It's a rabbit's foot. A lucky charm. My uncle wore it for 32 years.
A lucky charm, eh? Where'd you get it?
From my mother. With her own hand she took it off of my uncle after they hung him.

[referring to the travel stickers she's putting inside his trunks]
Look, Johnny, don't it look elegant?
Yeah, it's got class all right. Look, you dumb cluck, you got it pasted on the inside.
Sure, it gets scratched on the outside. Anybody's smart enough to know that!
Flo, sometimes you got me guessin' whether you're even a nitwit.

[riding with Flo in Clarence's back seat]
What's that whistlin' I hear?
That's Clarence makin' birdcalls. He's awful good.
[makes a hooting sound]
Want him to impersonate a robin?
What'll he do? Eat a worm?

[proposing to go to Willie at a mental institution in Jersey]
Oh, I'll get him all right. This is Little John Sarto. How long will it take us to drive over to where Willie's at?
Forty minutes the way you drive.
Oh, good, I'll tell him we'll pick him up.
Well, maybe he won't wanna leave. He told me on a postcard he's in a grand hideout and having a swell time with his mental disorder.
If he ever told you that on a postcard, maybe they ought to keep him in there.
When the heart speaks, Brother Orchid, other hearts must listen.
What are you doing?
Shaving your head.
No, you don't!
[to Brother Superior]
Do you have to?
No, it's quite optional.

[to Brother McEwan]
Well, nothin' doin'. I got my looks to think about.
Yeah? Well, say, that's swell. Heh heh. Say I'm glad you tipped me off. You know I ain't taken a bow in so long. I'm afraid my back will creak.
But you can't change a guy overnight. I'm such a mug that was taught to look for angles. Take things easy and you live a little longer.
I didn't double-cross you at Fat Duchy's. I wanted Jack Buck to make up with you. And I was dumb enough to believe him.
Yeah? What do you think now, I'm dumb enough to believe you?
Buck? Jack Buck?
Yes. Yes, that's it. How did you know?
Well, it come to me in a dream.
Brother Superior, I'm gonna blab a little. Then I'm gonna blow.
Now, wait a minute, Clarence. Johnny didn't never say no such thing.
Certainly, I didn't. I never said anything about you. Never even thought anything about you.
We don't waste much time with bad men, Mr. Sarto. Takes almost half a day to bring a man into court. That's a powerful waste of time.
You know, to such a guy like me... love is like a scratch on the back. Sometimes feels good. But a guy can't go along all his life with an itch.
Look, mum. Got any kids?
No. I ain't got nothing.
Well, you got something now.
Now, first of all, stop worrying about them flowers. You bring them back to the market tomorrow morning, you'll find that nobody ain't gonna bother you never no more.
